result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Rasmussen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard J Rasmussen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard J Rasmussen was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Richard J Rasmussen was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (>10,000g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)5.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation by 4:30 p.m. on 5/18/2016.
Must follow through with rules of Probation.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  If not paid during Probation, amount to be reduced to a civil judgment.
Must pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Probations.  If not paid during Probation, amount to be reduced to a civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
No use of illegal drugs.

Must report to Probation by 4:30 p.m. on 5/18/2016.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.

No use of illegal drugs.

Defendant Richard J Rasmussen in court with attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 2:37 pm  Atty Murtaugh notes errors.  State - no errors.  State makes argument.  Atty Murtaugh makes argument.  CT - Finds Def elig for SA Program, not elig for CIP.  Cannot possess firearm.  Cannot vote or hold elective office until civil rights are restored.  Loss of other civil rights until restored.  If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights..  Not eligible for expungement.  

Ct 1:  w/h sent, 2 yrs Prob, DNA sample & $250.00 surchg. $290.60 fine/cost, if not paid during prob, reduce to civil judgment, follow-thru w/probation, no use of illegal drugs, DL not susp.  Must report to probation by 4:30 on 5/18/16.

Ct 2:  I/S: 8 yrs WSP, 4 IC, 4 ES - 5 yrs Prob, can be discharge early if Prob feels appropriate, waive court costs, DL not susp, follow thru w/prob requirements, no use of illegal drugs, 1 yr cond time - 120 days upfront to begin 1/1/2017, subj WR, remainder banked for use by Probation if necessary.  Must report to probation by 4:30 on 5/18/16.  Credit for 4 days.  

14CM230 - based upon stip of the parties - dismissed w/prej & w/o costs.
